info.title: SCILL Admin API
info.description: SCILL gives you the tools to activate, retain and grow your user base in your app or game by bringing you features well known in the gaming industry: Gamification. We take care of the services and technology involved so you can focus on your game and content.

/api/v1/languages.description: Get a list of all available event types

get.summary: Get a list of all available languages
get.description: Returns a list of all available languages

404.description: The specified resource was not found

delete.description: Delete a battle pass level by id

parameters.name: battlePassId
parameters.description: The id of the battle pass

parameters.name: battlePassLevelId
parameters.description: The id of the battle pass level

404.description: The specified resource was not found

battle_pass_id.description: The unique id of this battle pass.

app_id.description: The unique id of the app

battle_pass_name.description: The name of the battle bass. You can set that in the Admin Panel. The language is set with the query parameter language. See documentation for more info on that.

battle_pass_description.description: The description of the battle bass. You can set that in the Admin Panel and it can also be HTML. The language is set with the query parameter language. See documentation for more info on that.
battle_pass_description.example: This battle pass gives you great fun and awesome rewards.

battle_pass_short_description.description: A short description of the battle bass. You can set that in the Admin Panel and it can also be HTML. The language is set with the query parameter language. See documentation for more info on that.
battle_pass_short_description.example: This battle pass gives you great fun and awesome rewards.

battle_pass_disclaimer.description: Use this to provide some terms and conditions following along this battle passes purchase.

battle_pass_priority.description: The priority of the battle pass. I.e. if multiple are available you can use this field to sort them.

package_sku_ios.description: If you want to sell Battle Passes you can use this field to trigger in-app purchase products within your mobile app. You can set this value in the Admin Panel. This one is for iOS.

package_sku_android.description: If you want to sell Battle Passes you can use this field to trigger in-app purchase products within your mobile app. You can set this value in the Admin Panel. Use this to set the package string for Android.

image_xs.description: The xs sized image name or url. You can determine the best size distribution yourself and depends on your application or UI

image_s.description: The s sized image name or url. You can determine the best size distribution yourself and depends on your application or UI

image_m.description: The m sized image name or url. You can determine the best size distribution yourself and depends on your application or UI

image_l.description: The l sized image name or url. You can determine the best size distribution yourself and depends on your application or UI

image_xl.description: The xl sized image name or url. You can determine the best size distribution yourself and depends on your application or UI

start_date.description: The date (in iso format) when the Battle Pass starts. Tracking begins once this date is passed.

end_date.description: The date (in iso format) when the Battle Pass ends. Tracking stops once the end is reached and users will not be able to progress further than what they have achieved up to that point.

read_more_link.description: If the Battle Pass costs money you may want to route the user to a web site/page, where they can learn more about this battle pass. You can also use this field to route the user inside your application by providing a path or whatever works for you.

is_unlocked_incrementally.description: Indicates if one level after the other must be activated or if users can activate whichever level they want. Typically battle passes are unlocked level by level, but if battle passes are used for other applications (like user referal programs) it can be useful to set this to false.

is_active.description: Indicated if this battle pass is active.

unlocked_at.description: The date in iso format when the user unlocked this Battle Pass.

can_purchase_with_money.description: Indicates that this Battle Pass can be purchased via in-app purchase. This can be set in the Admin Panel.

can_purchase_with_coins.description: Indicates that this Battle Pass can be purchased with SCILL Coins. This can be set in the Admin Panel.

battle_pass_id.description: The unique id of this battle pass.

app_id.description: The unique id of the app

is_active.description: Set if this level is active or not

reward_type_id.description: The id of the reward type

reward_amount.description: The reward amount as a string. Provide anything you like and that makes sense for your application

app_id.description: The unique id of the app

challenge_id.description: The unique id of this challenge. Every challenge is linked to a product.

challenge_name.description: The name of the challenge in the language set by the language parameter.

challenge_goal.description: Indicates how many tasks must be completed or done to complete this challenge.

challenge_goal_condition.description: With this you can set the way how the SCILL system approaches the challenges state. 0 means, that the counter of the challenge must be brought above the goal. If this is 1, then the counter must be kept below the goal. This is often useful for challenges that include times, like: Manage the level in under 50 seconds.

challenge_icon.description: In the admin panel you can set a string representing an image. This can be a URL, but it can also be an image or texture that you have in your games asset database.

challenge_icon_hd.description: This is the HD variant of the challenge icon image. If you have a game, that runs on multiple platforms that could come in handy. Otherwise just leave blank.

challenge_type.description: Indicates the status of the challenge. This can be one of the following unlock: Challenge does not track anything. in-progress: Challenge is active and tracking. overtime: User did not manage to finish the challenge in time. unclaimed: The challenge has been completed but the reward has not yet been claimed. finished: The challenge has been successfully be completed and the reward has been claimed

challange_xp.description: The experience points for this challenge. This is just a value you can set and make any use in your app

required_metadata_values.description: An internal flag that will be used to decide when this challenge should be triggered

battle_pass_level_id.description: The level id, i.e. battle_pass_level_id of the BattlePassLevel object

event_count.description: The number of events sent this month

event_limit.description: The number of events that can be sent each month in the current tariff

fusion_id.description: Internal user id of the 4Players domain

paid_tariff.description: Defines if this is a paid or free (explore) tariff.

user_id.description: This is your user id. You can set this to whatever you like, either your real user id or an obfuscated user id. However you need to be consistent here. Events linked to this user id only track if challenges or battle passes are unlocked with the same user id.

session_id.description: This is required if event_type is single and identifies a session. This can be anything used to group events together. For example this can be a level or a match id.

event_name.description: This is the event type as a string. These have predefined event names for many games and applications. Its wise to use those as this allows us to analyse data and help you balancing your application or game.

event_type.description: This is either single or group. You can send multiple events in one request (group) or send events in sequence. Please note, that depending on your tier you might run into rate limits.

meta_data.description: This holds metadata and is optional. However, you can use this to send additional info, like a weapon in a kill event. This way you can build more elaborate challenges like Kill 10 enemies with AK47 and with no armor protection.

language_name.description: The language in english language (human readable)

language_shortcode.description: International shortcode for the language (i.e. en, fr, de, es, it, ...)

user_id.description: Any string allowed, this is the foreign user identifier that has no relation in the SCILL database and the user is unkown to SCILL.

app_tag.description: A unique identifier for your game with only alphanumeric characters, dash and underscore

app_active.description: Indicates if this app is active. Use the DELETE route to deactivate an app

app_image.description: A string identifying the apps logo image in your own application. Can also be a URL.

app_image_hd.description: A string identifying the apps logo image in high quality in your own application. Can also be a URL.

has_battle_passes.description: Indicates if this app has activated the battle pass system

has_battle_challenges.description: Indicates if this app has activated the challenges system

request_count.description: Number of requests sent in the current month

rate_limit.description: The number of requests allowed per month

event_limit.description: The number of events allowed per month

app_tag.description: A unique identifier for your game with only alphanumeric characters, dash and underscore

app_image.description: A string identifying the apps logo image in your own application. Can also be a URL.

app_image_hd.description: A string identifying the apps logo image in high quality in your own application. Can also be a URL.

has_battle_passes.description: Indicates if this app has activated the battle pass system

has_battle_challenges.description: Indicates if this app has activated the challenges system

event_count.description: The number of events sent so far this month

label.description: Label used for the API Key

webhook_type.description: The type of the webhook. Many different areas within SCILL GaaS trigger webhooks. Refer to the documentation for all available types.

app_id.description: The id of your app that is linked to this webhook.

description.description: A string used to store some information about the webhook.

target_url.description: The URL to the webservices called by SCILL backends. This must be world open, i.e. reachable from the internet.

secret_key.description: A secret that is sent with the webhook. Implement that secret on your side to make sure, that this is an authorized request.

webhook_type.description: The type of the webhook. Many different areas within SCILL GaaS trigger webhooks. Refer to the documentation for all available types.

app_id.description: The id of your app that is linked to this webhook.

description.description: A string used to store some information about the webhook.

target_url.description: The URL to the webservices called by SCILL backends. This must be world open, i.e. reachable from the internet.

secret_key.description: A secret that is sent with the webhook. Implement that secret on your side to make sure, that this is an authorized request.

key_id.description: The id of the API key

app_id.description: The App Id. This is the id you need to use in most other endpoints

api_key.description: The API Key. Use your API key in the Authorization header as the Bearer. Please don't expose the API Key! This should only be used in server to server communication, not in clients. Generate an access token using this API key to be used in clients

enabled.description: Indicates if this API key is active.

id.description: The unique id of the category type

slug.description: A short name without special chars that can be used to hardcode things

name.description: The name of this category type

reward_type_id.description: The id of the reward type

reward_type.description: The type of the reward as a slug (machine readable format)

reward_name.description: The name of the reward in a human readable format

category_id.description: The unique id of the category

app_id.description: The id of the app this challenge category is linked to

category_type.description: The id of the challenge category type (see /api/v1/admin/challenge-category-available-types)

position.description: The position of the challenge category (use to change order in lists)

active.description: Indicates if this challenge category is active

category_name.description: The name of the challenge category in the current language

category_slug.description: A short name you can use to hardcode stuff in your code

app_id.description: The id of the app this challenge category is linked to

category_type.description: The id of the challenge category type (see /api/v1/admin/challenge-category-available-types)

category_name.description: The name of the challenge category in the current language

active.description: Indicates if this challenge category is active

challenge_type_mandatory_metadata.description: Mandatory meta data fields that need to be set in the event meta data payload

challenge_type_name.description: The name of the event type

challenge_type_name_humanized.description: The name of the event in a human readable format

challenge_type_non_mandatory_metadata.description: Optional event meta data available for this event type

challenge_id.description: The unique id of this challenge. Every challenge is linked to a product.

app_id.description: The id of the app this challenge is linked to

challenge_category_id.description: The id of the challenge category this challenge should be linked to

challenge_name.description: The name of the challenge in the language set by the language parameter.

challenge_duration_time.description: The duration of the challenge in seconds. Challenges auto lock after time-out and need to be unlocked again.

challenge_goal.description: Indicates how many tasks must be completed or done to complete this challenge.

challenge_goal_condition.description: With this you can set the way how the SCILL system approaches the challenges state. 0 means, that the counter of the challenge must be brought above the goal. If this is 1, then the counter must be kept below the goal. This is often useful for challenges that include times, like: Manage the level in under 50 seconds.

challange_price.description: The price for this challenge. This is just a value you can set and make any use in your app

challange_xp.description: The experience points for this challenge. This is just a value you can set and make any use in your app

challenge_icon.description: In the admin panel you can set a string representing an image. This can be a URL, but it can also be an image or texture that you have in your games asset database.

challenge_icon_hd.description: This is the HD variant of the challenge icon image. If you have a game, that runs on multiple platforms that could come in handy. Otherwise just leave blank.

challenge_description.description: An optional description the challenge in detail

repeatable.description: If this challenge can be only activated once per user this will be false. Otherwise this challenge will always be added to list of available challenges (see personal or alliance challenges).

challenge_auto_activated.description: Wether this challenge will be activated when requested by a user automatically or if users/clients need to activate challenges by hand or script.

period_range.description: If challenge is auto activated it will be reset at specific points in time. Options are daily (d), weekly (w), monthly (m) or never.

period_range_reset_at_time.description: The reset time this challenge will be set back. If period range is set to daily, then the challenge will be reset every day at this clock. If it's weekly, it will be set to 0 on Monday at this clock.

period_range_time_zone.description: The timezone used for reseting the challenge.

live_date.description: The date and time when this challenge should be activated. Use that to create challenges that will be visible in the future.

challenge_type.description: The event type used to drive this challenge

required_metadata_values.description: An internal flag that will be used to decide when this challenge should be triggered

is_battle_pass_challenge.description: If this is a battle pass challenge. Should always be false!

app_id.description: The id of the app this challenge is linked to

challenge_category_id.description: The id of the challenge category this challenge should be linked to

challenge_name.description: The name of the challenge in the language set by the language parameter.

challenge_description.description: An optional description the challenge in detail

challenge_type.description: The event type used to drive this challenge

challenge_reward_type_id.description: The id of the reward type.

repeatable.description: Wether the challenge will be available again after it has been won or lost. Otherwise it will not be delivered again.

is_battle_pass_challenge.description: If this is a battle pass challenge. Should always be false!

challenge_icon.description: In the admin panel you can set a string representing an image. This can be a URL, but it can also be an image or texture that you have in your games asset database.

challenge_icon_hd.description: This is the HD variant of the challenge icon image. If you have a game, that runs on multiple platforms that could come in handy. Otherwise just leave blank.

challenge_duration_time.description: The duration of the challenge in seconds. Challenges auto lock after time-out and need to be unlocked again.

challenge_goal.description: Indicates how many tasks must be completed or done to complete this challenge.

challange_price.description: The price for this challenge. This is just a value you can set and make any use in your app

challange_xp.description: The experience points for this challenge. This is just a value you can set and make any use in your app

challange_reward.description: The reward for this challenge. This is just a value you can set and make any use in your app

challenge_goal_condition.description: With this you can set the way how the SCILL system approaches the challenges state. 0 means, that the counter of the challenge must be brought above the goal. If this is 1, then the counter must be kept below the goal. This is often useful for challenges that include times, like: Manage the level in under 50 seconds.

live_date.description: The date and time when this challenge should be activated. Use that to create challenges that will be visible in the future.

challenge_auto_activated.description: Wether this challenge will be activated when requested by a user automatically or if users/clients need to activate challenges by hand or script.

period_range.description: If challenge is auto activated it will be reset at specific points in time. Options are daily (d), weekly (w), monthly (m) or never.

period_range_reset_at_time.description: The reset time this challenge will be set back. If period range is set to daily, then the challenge will be reset every day at this clock. If it's weekly, it will be set to 0 on Monday at this clock.

period_range_time_zone.description: The timezone used for reseting the challenge.

items.description: The value that needs to be set in an event so that it triggers this challenge. Depends on the metadata event structure for the specific type.

metadata_key.description: The event type that this challenge should listen to

conjunction.description: Can be OR and AND and defines if all values need to match or just any of the provided values

api_key.description: The app id of the app just created

NotFound.description: The specified resource was not found

BadRequest.description: Request could not complete as parameters were missing or were not set correctely.

BearerAuth.description: You can either use the API-Key or an Access Token generated earlier with the auth/generate-access-token route. Only use API-Key on server side, never expose it on client side. Use Access Tokens where possible. More info on this topic can be found here https://beta.developers.scillgame.com/api/authentication.html
